text: Bonnie Jeanne Dunbar (born March 3, 1949) is an engineer and retired NASA astronaut. == Biography == Dunbar was born in Sunnyside, Washington. She graduated from Sunnyside High School in. She went to University of Washington and received her undergraduate degree in ceramic engineering. She began her career as a system analyst at Boeing Computer Services. Dunbar became a payload officer/flight controller at the Lyndon B. Johnson Space Center. She served as a guidance and navigation officer/flight controller.https://www.nasa.gov/sites/default/files/atoms/files/dunbar_bonnie.pdf == References == Category:1949 births Category:Living people Category:American engineers Category:American astronauts
title: Bonnie J. Dunbar
